positionData.text: As a fellow candidate, I am qualified to be a part of the U-SU Board of Directors because of my experience with student engagement from student organizations here on campus. Some of these organizations include the Association for Computing Machinery (ACM), where I was the Vice President of Internal Affairs, responsible for member outreach and engagement through ACM's social media platforms. Another organization that I would include is MESA, where I was a volunteer to manage competitions held on campus, for middle and high school students from across LA County, showing them what the field of STEM and Engineering is all about. As a master's student that has been here at Cal State LA from 2019 until now, I see overtime, how students are feeling about the environment here, and how it might not be as engaging at times. Furthermore, I have went to other CSU campuses, seeing the lifestyle and engagement of the student population that would want to make them enroll there in the first place. My goal, if I were to become part of the Board of Directors, would to have students have their voices heard, and how we could improve the campus the best it could be, competing with the other CSU campuses. Not only that the changes that I will make last for current students, but for future students as well, as they consider enrolling to Cal State LA in the future.

I am a passionate and driven student pursuing my Master’s in Computer Science at California State University, Los Angeles. With a strong interest in technology, leadership, and community engagement, I actively seek opportunities to make a positive impact both on and off campus. I enjoy collaborating with diverse groups, advocating for student needs, and contributing to initiatives that promote inclusivity, innovation, and growth. Outside of academics, I am involved in various projects and organizations that aim to uplift student voices and foster a supportive campus environment.

As a dedicated student with a strong background in leadership, advocacy, and community engagement, I am committed to being a voice for all students as your University Student Union Student Director. Growing up in an immigrant family, I understand the value of opportunity, representation, and the power of collective action, which fuels my passion for ensuring every student feels heard and supported. My experience in healthcare, customer service, and social media management has shaped me into an adaptable and solution-oriented leader who thrives in diverse environments. I believe that student leadership is about more than just making decisions—it’s about creating lasting change, fostering inclusivity, and amplifying the concerns of those who often go unheard. By electing me, you are choosing a leader who will fight for resources, mental health support, and student success, ensuring that our university is a place where everyone can thrive because we all matter.

I am qualified to be a part of the U-SU Board of Directors because of my strong leadership and problem-solving skills, which I have developed through my experiences in cybersecurity, law enforcement, and public service. My background has equipped me with expertise in crisis management and advocacy, allowing me to effectively address the concerns of our diverse student body.

I love the Student Union Building and appreciate the role it plays in bringing students together. As a member of the U-SU Board of Directors, I will work to enhance its resources, particularly by improving computer access for students. I want to ensure that every student has the technology needed to complete homework, conduct research, and work on specialty IT labs.

I aim to enhance student life by expanding student support services, promoting inclusivity, and advocating for initiatives that support academic success, career development, and digital literacy. I am also committed to amplifying student voices by working closely with university administration to address concerns about tuition, campus safety, and equity in education.

A fun aspect I would love to improve is adding free vintage arcade machines throughout the building, providing students with a way to take a break and enjoy classic video games at no cost. Creating a more engaging and enjoyable environment in the Student Union will help students relax and connect with one another

Hello everyone!! My name is Emily, and I hope that you vote for me in the student elections for the University Student Union Board of Directors. I am a political science student, and I hope to run a political campaign, and even become a politician. This role would help me gain experience so I can be the best person for my future career. I hope to have first-hand experience in the logistical aspect of government work. I’ve always had the desire to make a difference in the world, no matter how little, and to be an advocate for those who cannot have a voice themselves. I am confident that being on the student board of directors is a great place to start and I promise to make the school a better place for all students. I am also the social chairwoman for my sorority, Delta Zeta, which has given me experience in planning events with other organizations on campus. I can apply the skills I’ve learned from this position to the board of directors position. This is why I believe I will be an amazing choice for the Student Union Board of Directors.

I am eager to serve as a member of the Cal State LA U-SU Board of Directors. My qualifications include co-founding the Project Rebound Sankofa Book Club and serving as its current Treasurer. I have also developed and facilitated workshops for Cal State LA Project Rebound and served as the Master of Ceremony for the 2024-2025 Project Rebound student orientation. My experience extends to lobbying for policy change and my current internship as a community advocate for at-promise youth. If elected, I will prioritize policies that foster growth and ensure financial stability for our Cal State LA campus.

As a second-year student at Cal State LA, I am eager to potentially serve on the U-SU Board of Directors alongside fellow students, members, and staff. My strong background in counseling and leadership demonstrates both my qualifications for this role and my passion for engaging with schools and organizations. In high school, I gained valuable experience as a college peer counselor, assisting seniors with their college and financial aid applications—an experience that honed my counseling skills and deepened my commitment to student success. Currently, I serve as a VITA volunteer, preparing tax returns for individuals who need assistance, showcasing my reliability, attention to detail, and dedication to community service. Recently, I joined the ALPFA club here at Cal State LA, where they enhance opportunities for Latinos and build leadership and career skills. I plan to associate with more clubs that align with my interests in the future. Through my leadership experiences and problem-solving abilities, I hope to exhibit my enthusiasm for contributing to the U-SU BOD.

I have been a Golden Eagle since my undergraduate years and am now a graduate student. I first received my bachelor's degree in psychology with a minor in Rehabilitation Services, and I am now pursuing my master's degree in the Educational Foundations M.A. program, studying to learn and apply skills in my future career in higher education. I am a Student Organization and Leadership Development Assistant at our University-Student Union's Center for Student Involvement. In this role, I lead and coordinate enrichment, leadership development, and wellness programs that unite the student community. For my LEAD Series program, where I encourage students to engage with themes of advocacy, I was proud to receive the ACUI Region | Student-Driven Program of the Year award. I am also the current Chair of the U-SU Board of Directors. In my role, I prioritize cultivating safe and inclusive spaces for our diverse student body. I am passionate about the U-SU and the home it provides for students and staff. The U-SU is my second home, and I aim to continue its path in fostering the needs and interests of students.

I am currently a sophomore at Cal State LA majoring in Computer Science and minoring in Psychology, Biomedical Engineering, and Math. I am interested in AI and Machine Learning as well as their applications to benefit the world. I enjoy challenges, learning new things, and am passionate about policy development and student success.

I'm serving as a Student Director this current year, and I'm running for the same position for next year. My involvement with the U-SU Board of Directors as a Student Director, ASI as an Undergraduate Academic Senator, the AI/ML Club as President and the RoboSubLA Club as Controls Team Lead within Cal State LA, and the nonprofit Kids4Kids Global as President beyond our university has prepared me to effectively advocate for your needs. I worked to address student concerns, improve academic policies, and promote initiatives that enhance our learning environment.

With strong leadership experience both within and beyond Cal State LA and interpersonal skills, I aim to connect with and advocate for students, engage the community, and contribute to positive campus change providing guidance for success. Let’s continue working together for a better future at Cal State LA!

I am expressing my strong interest into joining the U-SU Board of Directors in order make real progress towards a safe and better school. I provided about 2 years of related experience as the Safey Committee Chair in Huntington Memorial Hospital. I provide various knowledge in policy making and enforcing policies, along with the necessary work ethic to ensure every student's safety and well-being. If given the opportunity to serve on the Board, I would guarantee that my leadership and experience will benefit the students of Cal State LA by looking over every concern, whether that is with Student parking, or Safety concerns in our community. I urge you to vote for me into your Board of Directors for Cal State LA to prosper and achieve the goals we envisioned.

Pursuing an academic journey is more than just an educational decision; rather, a profound transition that shapes resilience, broadens perspectives, and redefines the meaning of community. And, as such, I am eager to serve on the U-SU Board of Directors to help create a campus where students—whether near or far—are indeed at home here at Cal State LA. My experiences in external jobs and volunteering roles have equipped me with the skills necessary for this position. From collaborating with diverse teams to managing complex responsibilities with my attention to detail, I've learned how to problem-solve effectively and follow through with success. Being part of the AANHPI Student Achievement Program has also contributed to enhancing my leadership skills, as well as the numerous campus events I attend and participate in. On top of that, my active involvement in my sorority as secretary and coordinator has further strengthened my ability to express my empathy, navigate different perspectives, and cultivate meaningful connections, all of which I will bring to the Board. I have the honest intention of running to be a part of the U-SU BOD, and I aim to grow in speaking up for myself so I can confidently do the same for people in need. I am ready to listen, learn, lead with integrity, and hopefully leave a lasting impact to ensure that every student feels valued and supported—all done by yours truly.
